name: 'Two Weeks Out' Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 7 | 10 Questions

questions.text: When Josh gets a call from a man named Bob, who is really on the other end?
questions.explanation:
Toby.

	When Josh answers the phone he mentions that Toby has called him twice in one and wants to know whose really running the campaign. Toby's keeping track of the campaign from his computer at home.

questions.text: What was wrong with Vinick's hand?
options: He had a severe rash on his palm
It wasn't his hand, but his leg
questions.explanation:
Broken metacarpal.

	A doctor diagnosed Vinick with a broken metacarpal, but Bruno wouldn't let Vinick go in for x-rays because of the headlines the trip to a hospital would cause.

Bruno.

	After Vinick and his team of people left the holding room in a Philadelphia hotel, Bruno found the briefcase. He only realized it belonged to Santos after he opened it and found a day planner and a check book.

questions.text: Did Jane Braun say Vinick was against gay marriage?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Jane Braun mentioned that Vinick was against gay marriage on the plane when they were leaving Pennsylvania.

questions.text: What did Josh say was in his briefcase that was not in Santos' briefcase?
options: Day planner with notes about everyone in it
questions.explanation:
Porn and heroin.

	Lou asked Josh if Santos' briefcase had anything important in it like heroin or porn and Josh said "no, those are in mine".

questions.text: What was not a state that Vinick and Santos were in at the same time in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Texas.

	California was Vinick's home state and Santos and Vinick were both campaigning in Chicago and Philadelphia. Only after hearing that Santos was headed to California did Vinick go.

questions.text: In California, where was Vinick while Santos was in Fresno?
options: On a plane going to the southern states
questions.explanation:
San Andreo nuclear plant.

	While Santos was greeting voters in Fresno, Vinick was holding a press conference outside the San Andreo nuclear plant. Josh was upset because Santos' free press time was being taken up by Vinick and his San Andreo press conference.

questions.text: Who told Josh to send Santos to California?
questions.explanation:
Toby.

	While Josh and Toby watched Vinick on TV in California, Josh asked Toby whose brilliant idea it was to send Santos to California.

No.

	No one from the White House was seen and neither was Annabeth, Leo, or Donna.

questions.text: When Vinick gave Santos his briefcase back, did Santos confess that he had once had an affair?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Santos wasn't going to say anything and then he told Vinick that his brother doesn't always face up to his responsibilities so Santos has been paying child support to his niece's mother for seven years.
